p: Viruses are an age-old foe of humans and have caused great loss of life on a global scale. For example, the “Spanish flu” outbreak (1918–1919) caused 50 million deaths worldwide [ 1]. RNA viruses of the Family Orthomyxoviridae [ 2]—including the influenza A(H1N1) virus—have caused many epidemics. The virus undergoes constant genetic changes and gave rise to the new H1N1 (swine flu or type A influenza), which started the pandemic that began in Mexico in 2009.
